p:
The exact target of SARS-CoV-2 infection is not fully clear. Based on the findings from SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV [18], [23], [24], [25], [26], [27], [56] and results from SARS-CoV-2 infection [36], [57], [58], SARS-CoV-2 can infect type II pneumocytes [59]. Target cells ( T) are assumed to be infected by SARS-CoV-2 ( V) to generate infected cells ( I) at a mass action rate
β
VT. Infected cells die with a death rate
δ
. They produce coronaviruses at a rate p per infected cell. The virus is cleared at a constant rate c.
